description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts that relate to the taxonomy language found in either the HITRUST Threat Catalogue or the ENISA Threat Taxonomy.
name: OSRS Operational Framewrok - Human Threat
source: HITRUST Threat Catalogue and the ENISA Threat Taxonomy

values.description: Deliberate actions aimed to cause disruption or damage to information and/or IT assets for financial or personal gain.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIC1 Sabotage

values.description: The use of violence as a means to create terror among masses of people; or fear to achieve a financial, political, religious or ideological aim.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIC2 Terrorism

values.description: Deliberate destruction or damage to information and (or) IT assets but, not for personal gain.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIC3 Vandalism

values.description: To appropriate something, such as property entrusted to one's care fraudulently to one's own use. A form of theft through fraud.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM1 Embezzlement

values.description: The act of obtaining money, property, or services from an organization through coercion.  A form of theft through use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM2 Extortion

values.description: Deliberate deception to secure unfair or unlawful gain, or to deprive a victim of a legal right.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM3 Fraud

values.description: The act of logically stealing and (or) removing of the property with intent to deprive the rightful owner of it.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LIM4 Theft

values.description: Unintentional distribution of covered information to an unauthorized entity by an employee or employees.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUH1 Data Sharing or Leakage

values.description: Changing of data and records (information) stored in devices and storage media.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUH2 Improper Data Modification.

values.description: Inappropriate or inadequate labeling or classifying of media.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUH3 Misclassifying of Data

values.description: Unintentional mishandling of passwords leading to leakage of covered information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUH4 Mishandling of Passwords

values.description: Loss of integrity of certificates used for authorization services.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM1 Certificate Integrity Loss

values.description: An account id or username has been used (or) accessed by a non-authorized means.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM2 Compromised Credentials

values.description: Storage media that retains stored information in a retrievable/intact manner longer than desired (failure to totally erase).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM3 Data Remanence

values.description: Loss of a data-storage medium.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM4 Data Storage Media Loss

values.description: Loss of the integrity or consistency of a database may result in the data being incorrect or in a corrupt state and as a result may not be accessed or processed correctly.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM5 Database Integrity Loss

values.description: Roles or permissions that if misused could allow a person to exploit the  systems for his or her own gain or purpose.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM6 Elevated Privileges

values.description: Loss due to improper IT asset or business processes design (inadequate specifications of IT products, inadequate usability, insecure interfaces, policy (or) procedure flows, design errors, and changes).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM7 Improperly Designing Information Systems

values.description: Depending on the requirements defined by the organization, a poorly planned network infrastructure may impact the confidentiality of data and the integrity of the network, which may lead to unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information to unauthorized users.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM8 Improperly Designing Network Infrastructure

values.description: Management of cryptographic keys in a cryptosystem. This includes dealing with the generation, exchange, storage, use, crypto-shredding (destruction) and replacement of keys.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM9 Inappropriate or Inadequate Key Management

values.description: Inadequate testing on new systems may result in possible errors in the hardware or software or that they may remain undetected or may result in significant disruption to IT operations or systems.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM10 Insufficiently or Inadequately Following Release Procedures

values.description: Lack of or insufficient logging may prevent the organization from determining whether security specifications were violated or whether attacks were attempted. Additionally, organizations may not be able to assess whether logged information can be used for error analysis in the event of damage and for determining the causes or for integrity tests.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM11 Lack-of or Insufficient Logging

values.description: Loss of records by improper or unauthorized use of storage devices.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM12 Loss Due to Unauthorized Storage

values.description: The malicious use of network scanning tools to discover open and possibly unused ports, protocols, and services as well as vulnerabilities.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM13 Misuse of Audit Tools

values.description: Leaking covered information as a result of using mobile device applications.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM14 Mobile Device Applications Data Leakage

values.description: Information leak, sharing, or damage caused by misuse of information assets (lack of awareness of application features) (or) wrong (or) improper information assets configuration or management.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM15 System Configuration Errors

values.description: A violation of the set of rules applied by senior management or the asset (or) resource owner of a network, website, or service, that restrict the ways in which the network, website or system may be used and sets guidelines as to how it should be used.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM16 Unacceptable Use

values.description: Does not allow for prescription of information protection.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM17 Unmanaged Data

values.description: Leakage of covered information  when using web applications.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST LUM18 Web Applications Data Leakage.

values.description: To appropriate something, such as property entrusted to one's care fraudulently to one's own use. A form of theft through fraud.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PIM1 Embezzlement

values.description: The act of obtaining money, property, or services from an organization through coercion.  A form of theft through use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PIM2 Extortion

values.description: Deliberate deception to secure unfair or unlawful gain, or to deprive a victim of a legal right. A form of theft through deception.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PIM3 Fraud

values.description: The act of physically stealing, taking and removing of the property with intent to deprive the rightful owner of it.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PIM4 Theft

values.description: Unavailability of key personnel, their competencies, skills, and knowledge.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUH1 Absence of Personnel

values.description: Sudden damage as a result of an unexpected and non-deliberate action.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUH2 Accidental Damage

values.description: Fire unintentionally set by a human.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUH3 Accidental Fire

values.description: Accidently or unintentionally losing any physical IT Asset.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUH4 Loss of IT Assets

values.description: Unintentional mishandling of passwords leading to leakage of covered information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUH5 Mishandling of Passwords

values.description: Accidental verbal disclosure of sensitive information by unauthorized individuals overhearing.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUH6 Unintentional Information Sharing

values.description: Loss of information due to errors in installation or system configuration.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM1 Configuration Errors

values.description: Loss due to improper IT asset or business processes design (inadequate specifications of IT products, inadequate usability, insecure interfaces, policy, procedure flows, design errors, and changes).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM2 Improperly Designing Information Systems

values.description: Depending on the requirements defined by the organization, a poorly planned network infrastructure may impact the confidentiality of data and the integrity of the network, which may lead to unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information to unauthorized users.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM3 Improperly Designing Network Infrastructure

values.description: Unauthorized changes of hardware devices such as removing memory or hard drive.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM4 Manipulation of Hardware

values.description: Manipulation due to unauthorized hardware.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM5 Rogue Hardware

values.description: Unauthorized access by convienence or courtesy.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM6 Tailgating

values.description: A set of rules applied by senior management and (or) the owner of the equipment, information, and etc. may be used and sets guidelines as to how it should be used.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: HITRUST PUM7 Unacceptable Use

values.description: Information leakage, sharing, or damage as the result of IT asset misuse by user lack of awareness of application features (or) improper configuration of IT assets. This may cause loss of information from operator error, configuration erro, or user error. Erroneous use of administration devices may also hamper system recovery times.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Erroneous Use or Administration of Devices and Systems

values.description: Poor decision making based on unreliable sources of information or unchecked information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Using Information from an Unreliable Source

values.description: Loss of information integrity due to human error (information system user mistake).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Unintentional Change of Data in an Information System

values.description: Threats caused by improper IT assets or business processes design (inadequate specifications of IT products, inadequate usability, insecure interfaces, policy, procedure flows, or design errors).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Inadequate Design and Planning or Improper Adaptation

values.description: Threats of damage of IT Assets caused by third party. This may also include security failures by third parties.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Damage Caused by a Third Party

values.description: Threats to information systems caused by improper or unprepared IT penetration testing activities.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Damages Resulting from Penetration Testing

values.description: Threats of loosing information or data stored in the cloud.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Loss of Information in the Cloud

values.description: Threats of loosing information or data (or changing) information classified as sensitive. This may include loss of certificate integrity as well.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Loss of or Integrity of Sensitive Information

values.description: Threats of the lack of availability (loosing) of IT Assets and documents. This may be the result of lost mobile devices, storage media, or documentation.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Loss of Devices, Storage Media, or Documents

values.description: Threats of the lack of availability (destruction) of data and records (information) stored in devices and storage media. This may also include infected removable media or storage abuse.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Destruction of Records

values.description: Threat of unintentional but damaging distribution of information due to human error.  May include accidental leaks by employees, leaks via mobile applications, leaks via web applications, or leaks of information transfered over network mediums.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Human Threat: ENISA Information Leakage OR Sharing Due to Human Error
